page.title: 19NEWLAND WITH REDBROOK
page.content: The church has played an important part in the life of our villages for many hundreds of years.Until about a hundred years ago this parish included not only{Redbrook}but places such as {Clearwell, Bream, Coleford}and{Christ- {church.}Before other churches were built people from a large part of the {Forest of Dean}and{Wye Valley}went to the{Church of All Saints,}at{Newland, for church services and special occasions like weddings and funerals. This church was begun in about 1200. Later additions were made including a {Clearwell Chapel,}a chapel (now the {Lady Chapel)}from which priests went to miners in the Forest, and the church porch with a room above which was used as a school. Recently restored, this church is open for prayer, meetings, thanksgiving, concerts and exhibitions.
